conclusion: Objects A and B are dropped and come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F due to gravity.
When A and B are dropped, gravity makes them fall straight down.
The first surfaces A and B meet are the flat tops of C, D, E, and F, so the fall stops locally at those spots.
The rest of each sheet continues to move, letting the material drape and slide down the vertical faces of the blocks.
The sheets finally come to rest wrapped over the blocks and lying on the tabletop, showing bulges where the blocks push the cloth outward and deep folds in the gaps beside the blocks.
Two pinned cloths now hang in a curtain-like shape.
Clear impressions of the four prisms underneath each cloth are visible, with high spots on top and vertical folds on the sides.
